彲字的基本解释

彲
chī
见“彨”。

彲字的汉语字典释义

[①]［chī］
［《廣韻》丑知切，平支，徹。］
亦作“彨1”。
即螭。传说中的一种蛟龙，无角。

彲字的康熙字典解释

【寅集下】【彡字部】　彲； 康熙笔画：22； 页码：页364第28
【廣韻】丑知切【集韻】【正韻】抽知切。?與螭同。【玉篇】獸名。【集韻】若龍而黃，北方謂之地螻。一說無角螭。【史記·齊世家】西伯將出獵，卜之曰：所獲非龍非彲，非虎非羆，所獲霸王之輔。於是果得太公於渭之南。

彲字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
彲字的起名意思

暂无。

彲
Basic explanation of words
彲
chī
See "彨".
彲
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［chī］
["Guangyun" ugly knowing cut, flat branch, thorough. ]
Also known as "彨1".
That is Chi. A fabled dragon without horns.
彲
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Yin Ji 2] [彡字部] 　彲; Kangxi strokes: 22; Page number: page 364 28
【Guang Yun】Ugly know and cut 【Ji Yun】【Zheng Yun】Cut know and cut. ? Same as Chi. 【Jade articles】The name of the beast. [Jiyun] If the dragon is yellow, the north is called the worm. Say no horns. [Historical Records·Qi Family] Xibo will go out hunting, Bu Zhi said: What you get is neither dragon nor tiger, nor tiger nor tiger, and the overlord's assistant. So Guode was too public in the south of Weizhi.
